trans-unit.source: Operations on DNS zones | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Operations on DNS zones | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: You can manage DNS zones using Azure Powershell cmdlets or CLI.
trans-unit.target: You can manage DNS zones using Azure Powershell cmdlets or CLI.

trans-unit.source: How to update, delete and create DNS zones on Azure DNS
trans-unit.target: How to update, delete and create DNS zones on Azure DNS

trans-unit.source: How to manage DNS Zones
trans-unit.target: How to manage DNS Zones

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.SELECTOR]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.SELECTOR]

trans-unit.source: Azure CLI
trans-unit.target: Azure CLI

trans-unit.source: Azure Powershell
trans-unit.target: Azure Powershell

trans-unit.source: This guide will show how to manage your DNS zone.
trans-unit.target: This guide will show how to manage your DNS zone.

trans-unit.source: It will help understanding the sequence of operations to be done in order to administer your DNS zone.
trans-unit.target: It will help understanding the sequence of operations to be done in order to administer your DNS zone.

trans-unit.source: Create a new DNS zone
trans-unit.target: Create a new DNS zone

trans-unit.source: To create a new DNS zone to host your domain, use the `azure network dns zone create`:
trans-unit.target: To create a new DNS zone to host your domain, use the `azure network dns zone create`:

trans-unit.source: The operation creates a new DNS zone in Azure DNS.
trans-unit.target: The operation creates a new DNS zone in Azure DNS.

trans-unit.source: You can optionally specify an array of Azure Resource Manager tags, for more information see [Etags and Tags](dns-getstarted-create-dnszone.md#Etags-and-tags).
trans-unit.target: You can optionally specify an array of Azure Resource Manager tags, for more information see [Etags and Tags](dns-getstarted-create-dnszone.md#Etags-and-tags).

trans-unit.source: The name of the zone must be unique within the resource group, and the zone must not exist already, otherwise the operation will fail.
trans-unit.target: The name of the zone must be unique within the resource group, and the zone must not exist already, otherwise the operation will fail.

trans-unit.source: The same zone name can be re-used in a different resource group or a different Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: The same zone name can be re-used in a different resource group or a different Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: Where multiple zones share the same name, each instance will be assigned different name server addresses, and only one instance can be delegated from the parent domain.
trans-unit.target: Where multiple zones share the same name, each instance will be assigned different name server addresses, and only one instance can be delegated from the parent domain.

trans-unit.source: See [Delegate a Domain to Azure DNS](dns-domain-delegation.md) for more information.
trans-unit.target: See [Delegate a Domain to Azure DNS](dns-domain-delegation.md) for more information.

trans-unit.source: Get a DNS zone
trans-unit.target: Get a DNS zone

trans-unit.source: To retrieve a DNS zone, use the `azure network dns zone show`:
trans-unit.target: To retrieve a DNS zone, use the `azure network dns zone show`:

trans-unit.source: The operation returns a DNS zone with its id, number of record sets and tags.
trans-unit.target: The operation returns a DNS zone with its id, number of record sets and tags.

trans-unit.source: List DNS zones
trans-unit.target: List DNS zones

trans-unit.source: To retrieve DNS zones within a resource group, use `azure network dns zone list`:
trans-unit.target: To retrieve DNS zones within a resource group, use `azure network dns zone list`:

trans-unit.source: Update a DNS zone
trans-unit.target: Update a DNS zone

trans-unit.source: Changes to a DNS zone resource can be made using `azure network dns zone set`.
trans-unit.target: Changes to a DNS zone resource can be made using `azure network dns zone set`.

trans-unit.source: This does not update any of the DNS record sets within the zone (see [How to Manage DNS records](dns-operations-recordsets.md)).
trans-unit.target: This does not update any of the DNS record sets within the zone (see [How to Manage DNS records](dns-operations-recordsets.md)).

trans-unit.source: It is only used to update properties of the zone resource itself.
trans-unit.target: It is only used to update properties of the zone resource itself.

trans-unit.source: This is currently limited to the Azure Resource Manager ‘tags’ for the zone resource.
trans-unit.target: This is currently limited to the Azure Resource Manager ‘tags’ for the zone resource.

trans-unit.source: See [Etags and Tags](dns-getstarted-create-dnszone.md#Etags-and-tags) for more information.
trans-unit.target: See [Etags and Tags](dns-getstarted-create-dnszone.md#Etags-and-tags) for more information.

trans-unit.source: Delete a DNS Zone
trans-unit.target: Delete a DNS Zone

trans-unit.source: DNS zones can be deleted using the `azure network dns zone delete`.
trans-unit.target: DNS zones can be deleted using the `azure network dns zone delete`.

trans-unit.source: Before deleting a DNS zone in Azure DNS, you will need to delete all records sets, except for the NS and SOA records at the root of the zone that were created automatically when the zone was created.
trans-unit.target: Before deleting a DNS zone in Azure DNS, you will need to delete all records sets, except for the NS and SOA records at the root of the zone that were created automatically when the zone was created.

trans-unit.source: This operation has an optional ‘-q’ switch which suppresses the prompt to confirm you want to remove the DNS zone.
trans-unit.target: This operation has an optional ‘-q’ switch which suppresses the prompt to confirm you want to remove the DNS zone.
